18$Condition: Migraine Prevention$5/24/2010 12:01:51 PM$Reviewer: Raj, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$I am a long time cluster headache sufferer - episodal not chronic. The last time I had it I was on the drug for about 10 weeks. I had other drugs too as preventive medicines. The combination helped me to get out of the headaches. Even otherwise I would have been out of it. That is the typical time period for my cluster. One side effect ( may be ) is dry skin like psoraisis - it was bad. Now it is getting better. Another effect was trembling of my hands when I tried to pick something like a glass of water. It has gotten better since I am off the drug. Drowsiness was there but it made it difficult to go to sleep.
19$Condition: Migraine Prevention$4/19/2010 9:33:59 PM$Reviewer: angel_fire0979, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$4$I have been on this for over a year.  After trying multiple meds that caused me to gain weight, back-and-forth prevention of migraines, and changes in my blood pressure that is already low, I landed on this one.  I am to take one to two 500mg at bedtime since it may cause drowsiness.  That is a happy change since so many of the other meds caused insomnia.  I still have a lot of weight from trying to find the right med, but am glad that this is working for its primary goal--headache free.  I am thrilled that it works, but am looking to get off meds so that my body can readjust.  Not sure how much this med affects periods, but I have missed two in a year now and I used to be VERY regular!  I will be going in for a check-up again to make sure that it isn't affecting anything else.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$3$5$"Been on this for over 2 years (minus 1 month) the Depakote ER version (The brand name one).

column1: I had really bad migraines with aura (including tingling in left arm
column2: left leg tightness
column8: followed by a moderate headache...total disruption of my life
column9: I had even just moved and started a new job (luckily not much was expected of me at work when I started).

column2: did not relieve aura symptoms and cause terrible insomnia and was giving me terrible side effects.
went to specialist
column5: and other test to make sure of the diagnosis
column7: worked within a few days. I was back to my normal self.

column2: and greatly controlled headache pain (only occasional ""sinus pain"" caused by migraine remained). I was prescribed amitryptiline 25 mg/day for this pain and IBS burning
column3: I only take it occasionally not regularly.

column1: The low dose of amitryptiline seemed to augment the positive effects of the Depakote (at first would have some very minor prickling or stinging paid from the combo
column2: but it went away in a month and wasn't a problem).

column1: I get a rash 8 hours after I put on sunscreen
column2: but I think this happened once before when I wasn't even taking Depakote (I wasn't taking anything as a recall).

column1: No noticeable side effects from Depakote at first.
I gained 20 lbs over a year
column2: but it might've been from my thyroid being underactive (this was found later on
column3: and is not necessarily related to the depakote according to my doctor). Also might've been because my appetite returned because I was feeling healthy again.

column1: The insomnia I experienced from Topamax disappeared after switching to this. However
column2: I have not tried the new generic
column3: and my insurance is forcing to do the generic the next time I refill."
